title: Intraoperative Fluid Dosing in Adult Patients
description: Calculates intraoperative IV fluid requirements for adult patients during surgery, providing hourly fluid requirement, fluid deficit, and hour-by-hour fluid requirement based on surgical needs. Uses patient weight, NPO time, and surgical trauma severity to guide perioperative fluid management and optimize patient outcomes.

parameters.name: weight_kg
parameters.description: Patient body weight in kilograms (must be ≥20 kg for adult calculator)

parameters.name: hours_npo
parameters.description: Time spent NPO (nothing by mouth) before surgery in hours

parameters.name: surgical_trauma
parameters.description: Estimated surgical trauma severity based on procedure type and invasiveness

result.name: fluid_plan
result.description: Structured intraoperative fluid dosing plan with hourly requirements

ranges.interpretation: Procedures with minimal tissue trauma and fluid loss such as laparoscopic procedures. Requires 3 mL/kg/hr additional fluid replacement for surgical losses.
Procedures with moderate tissue trauma and fluid loss such as open cholecystectomy. Requires 5 mL/kg/hr additional fluid replacement for surgical losses.
Procedures with significant tissue trauma and fluid loss such as bowel resection or major abdominal surgery. Requires 7 mL/kg/hr additional fluid replacement for surgical losses.

references: Miller RD, et al. Miller's Anesthesia. 8th ed. Philadelphia: Elsevier Saunders; 2015.
Holte K, Sharrock NE, Kehlet H. Pathophysiology and clinical implications of perioperative fluid excess. Br J Anaesth. 2002;89(4):622-32.

Brandstrup B, et al. Effects of intravenous fluid restriction on postoperative complications: comparison of two perioperative fluid regimens: a randomized assessor-blinded multicenter trial. Ann Surg. 2003;238(5):641-8.
Gan TJ, et al. Goal-directed intraoperative fluid administration reduces length of hospital stay after major surgery. Anesthesiology. 2002;97(4):820-6.
formula: Hourly maintenance = weight (kg) + 40 mL; NPO deficit = hourly maintenance × hours NPO; Hour 1 = ½ NPO deficit + maintenance; Hours 2-3 = ¼ NPO deficit + maintenance + surgical trauma loss; Hour 4+ = maintenance + surgical trauma loss
notes: Designed for patients weighing ≥20 kg undergoing surgery
Not recommended for patients with fluid overload risks (heart failure, COPD, kidney failure)
Surgical trauma classifications: Minimal (3 mL/kg/hr), Moderate (5 mL/kg/hr), Severe (7 mL/kg/hr)
This calculator provides baseline fluid requirements - clinical judgment required for adjustments
Monitor urine output, blood pressure, and other hemodynamic parameters during surgery
Consider goal-directed fluid therapy and individualized patient needs
